clinical_study.brief_title: Cytokine Evaluation of Accelerated Tooth Movement
clinical_study.official_title: Cytokine Expression in Gingival Crevicular Fluid and Accelerated Tooth Movement

brief_summary.textblock: Gingival Crevicular Fluid samples will be collected using periopapers after accelerated tooth movement technique, results will be achieve with cytokine measurements that will be done using Luminex Assays and cytometer flow

detailed_description.textblock: For this prospective study, 50 individuals will be selected, with skeletal discrepancies randomly divided into two groups: 1 - accelerated tooth movement technique (ATMT) and 2 - Control. Orthodontic records done in two times, initial and preoperative; Gingival Crevicular Fluid samples will be collected using periopapers in 7 times. Flapless cortical perforations will be made in ATMT Group after dental extraction. Surgical protocol will be flapless to preserve periodontal health. After extraction space closure, results will be achieved by cytokine measurements (CCL2/MCP-1,CCL3/MIP-1 alpha, CCL5/RANTES, CXCL8/IL8, IL-1 alpha, IL-1 beta, IL6, TNF-alpha; TRANCE/RANK L, TNF RII) that will be done using Luminex Assays and cytometer flow. After collecting data, the results will be statistically analyzed.

primary_outcome.description: Measure the different levels of listed cytokines after starting the anterior retraction (i.e Rank and Rank-L in participation for the micro-osteoperforation group and control group)

arm_group.description: Control group, with traditional orthodontic mechanics for anterior retraction. Crevicular fluid will be collected during anterior retraction mechanics to identified cytokine in inflammatory process

Group with micro-osteoperforation for accelerated tooth movement during anterior retraction, Crevicular fluid will be collected during anterior retraction mechanics to identified cytokine in inflammatory process

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adolescent and adult subjects ages 16-55 years old, in good general health, with adult complete dentition, regardless of presence of third molars.
- Indication for orthognathic surgery
- Tooth extraction indication for orthodontic treatment
- Do not smoke
- Periodontal and teeth healthy
- Do not use bisphosphonates or corticosteroids
Exclusion Criteria:
- Surgically assisted rapid palatal expansion indication
- Cleft lip and palate
- Craniofacial syndrome
- Mental disorder
